channel.title: Only 1 starter per character?
channel.description: How do I give only 1 starter per character?

item.title: Only 1 starter per character?
item.dc:creator: @Owner_Wayne Owner Wayne
item.description:
@Owner_Wayne wrote:

Im kinda new at this and tbh, Im super confused…Im a “basic” coder at 508s…If one of u could like explain it? Thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: Only 1 starter per character?
item.dc:creator: @relmitos relmitos
item.description:
@relmitos wrote:

Instead of being such a * you could’ve explained your statement in the first place to avoid misunderstanding?

Read full topic

item.title: Only 1 starter per character?
item.dc:creator: @Slave_Scyth Slave Scyth
item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

[quote=“relmitos, post:6, topic:325920”]I’ve got no clue on what you’re trying to say… And by the looks of it neither do you.[/quote]The JVM isn’t going to remove starter from its memory… ever, until that client instance is removed. There was NO need for a public declaration.

And since starter’s value is set by starterReceived’s value, ‘starterReceived = Boolean.valueOf(starter)’ is a useless statement. It’s going to be set to what it already is.

I know what I’m talking about. You just have a comprehension problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Only 1 starter per character?
item.dc:creator: @relmitos relmitos
item.description:

I’ve got no clue on what you’re trying to say… And by the looks of it neither do you.

Read full topic

item.title: Only 1 starter per character?
item.dc:creator: @Slave_Scyth Slave Scyth
item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

[quote=“relmitos, post:4, topic:325920”]Declare:

public boolean starterReceived;
public String starter = new Boolean(starterReceived).toString();
characterfile.write("character-starter = ", 0, 20);
characterfile.write(starter, 0, starter.length());

if (token.equals("character-starter")) { starterReceived = Boolean.valueOf(starter); [/quote]And THAT is why we have so much wasted memory with current servers. There is absolutely no need to declare ‘starter’ as a public String.

Also, why the hell would you put “starterReceived = Boolean.valueOf(starter)” when starter is already based off of starterReceived?

sigh

Read full topic

item.title: Only 1 starter per character?
item.dc:creator: @relmitos relmitos
item.description:
@relmitos wrote:

Declare:

public boolean starterReceived;
public String starter = new Boolean(starterReceived).toString();
characterfile.write("character-starter = ", 0, 20);
characterfile.write(starter, 0, starter.length());
if (token.equals("character-starter")) {
    starterReceived = Boolean.valueOf(starter);

item.title: Only 1 starter per character?
item.dc:creator: @Owner_Wayne Owner Wayne
item.description:
@Owner_Wayne wrote:

[quote=“Slave Scyth, post:2, topic:325920”]Create a boolean, receivedStarter. Save that boolean in the “I’m gonna save yer characters!” method. Load that boolean in the “I’m gonna load yer character!” method.

The rest, I’ll leave up to you.[/quote]
What…?

Read full topic

item.title: Only 1 starter per character?
item.dc:creator: @Slave_Scyth Slave Scyth
item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

Create a boolean, receivedStarter. Save that boolean in the “I’m gonna save yer characters!” method. Load that boolean in the “I’m gonna load yer character!” method.

The rest, I’ll leave up to you.

Read full topic
